reviewText:
Before playing, I applied the adult patch in order to unlock the full story (it's not actually a patch; it's a boolean setting). I also altered the font as the white glow around blue words was a bit annoying. On my second run, I put the censoring back on to see how the editing went. This helps provide dual input for the review.

At first, it seemed like it would be typical anime VN. At the start, it's all guy at school with 2 girls he's hot for. But, that just leads to the real story involving some serious social problems.

In the typical what's it like as the opposite sex" style
date: the adult version involves some extended masturbatory scenes when he first takes over each one. The censored version has at least one awkward cut where the dialog obviously implies what just happened
recommended: but the transition also made it obvious that something big was cut out. There's another couple of scenes that give the wrong impression with the censoring in place. If you can tolerate hentai
hoursPlayed: you may want to enable the adult content just for continuity. It also extends the length of the story
voteText: and some of it provides extra plot detail for Akiko's situation.\n\nBack to the story. The initial takeover does involve the curious exploration due to the novelty of being in someone else's body
helpfulPercent: but it's not the main focus. It's more of a Quantum Leap style situation. The story revolves around him trying to figure out what is going on
votesHelpful: learning about the truth of their lives
votesTotal: and then trying to change them for the better. We never find out why or how he was jumping
votesFunny: but we (and he) learn that his two love interests
commentsCount: both of whom he thought were so perfect
column16: actually have dark secrets.\n\nOne of them has a bullying and consequential confidence problem. The other has an exploitative relationship and severe depression. I know most of this all too well. So
column17: I could actually relate to the girls' situations and connect with them more. When all of this started up
column18: I was drawn in. The story does not have branching
column19: but the choices do end up causing slight variations in outcome and dialog. In the end
column20: the choices made while possessing each one will decide if either one reveals their feelings
column21:
or if one of the bad endings happen.

There are a few negative points to mention:
The adult scenes could've been toned down a bit. I can understand some R or NC-17 type content
column22: but the extended XXX ones were a bit much. For a VN
column23: they even seemed weird. With Kasumi
column24: the scene was way ahead of what the dialog was saying. There are only 2 or 3 frames used for each of them
column25: so the "action" in the dialog just wasn't in sync. Also
column26: the ending scenes were superfluous. They are simply fan service.\nThe default slightly smiling pose for both girls is used quite a lot during some serious situations. At the very least
column27: it could've used a more neutral expression. It would've been even better if the face showed the emotion of the dialog.\nThe pool scene is too detailed
column28: and it doesn't match the description in the dialog. Right near the start of it
column29: the dialog mentions the water reflecting on the ceiling
column30: yet it's an outdoor pool. Some more dialog also makes it sound indoors.\nThe game is quite short. I'm sure that all of the plot components could've been expanded upon without requiring more adult gratuity
column31: and it would've been nice to have some type of information on how/why he could jump in the first place.\nDue to the mostly serious nature of the story and how it covers some really important topics
column32: as well as hopefully providing an important lesson or insight for certain players
column33: I am recommending this one. I hate to even use this word since it's overused and abused
column34: but some people may be "triggered" by the content. Consider yourself warned. Also
column35: the price is a bit high for the length
column36: but I got it on the Anime Weekend Sale for $3.14
column37:
so I think I got my money's worth.

---

reviewText:
The game is extremely short.

It has a few choices, but the story doesn't branch. All the choices do is determine which of the three endings you get.

It took me less than an hour to get the two good endings, and I can't be bothered to try to get the bad one.

I'm extremely disappointed by the game. Even though it is fairly cheap, it still feels like a rip-off.

(Bought this on Mangagamer, so my playtime is actually about an hour.)

reviewText:
Highschool Possession

Highschool Possession is a Visual Novel [VN] done by Dharker Studio. Highschool Possession is a VN about a guy who wakes up in the bodies of his two female friends [one a day]. He always held his friends in the perfect status, that nothing in their life could trouble them. As he's in their bodies, he learns about the things each of his friends go through, one being bullied and the other depressed and suicidal.

The main character in these two girls bodies and experiences the things they do, able to read about what HE" did in their body
date: through their diary the next time he returns. He messes things up for both of the girls
recommended: but in the end pulls through for them both
hoursPlayed: helping them through their situations. The VN itself is very short
voteText: very few choices and doesn't branch or change the story much. It takes about 2-3 hours to complete and get the achievements.\n\nI can recommend this if you get it on sale
commentsCount: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I liked this more than I expected. Aside from a couple of gratuitous masturbation scenes if you use the adult patch, the focus is not on body swapping as a fetish, but on the confusion and uncertainty of having to take charge of someone else's life, knowing you might screw it up. It's a short visual novel (took me a little over an hour to reach all four endings), so the problems the girls are dealing with aren't explored in great depth, but they do feel realistic, and the writing is better than other AJTilley VNs I've read. Recommended in a bundle, but not at full price.
voteText: 9 of 13 people (69%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Story:

The story revolves around Hikaru, who mysteriously gets body swapped with his two crushes after a strange headache. He is now tasked with fixing their lives, or he might never get back to his own body!

Art:

The art is well done and the style is consistent, there are a decent number of CG's that art doesn't feel re-used unless when necessary.

Length:

This visual novel will take you around 1.5-2 hours to complete

Soundtrack:

The soundtrack is decent, there are a couple of tracks that sound good on their own, everything syncs up with the mood of the scene.

Overall:

I would recommend Highscool Possession to fans of slice of life or mystery VN's. It has an interesting story that compels you to complete it, and contains multiple endings.

reviewText:
I was really expecting something totally different. But way different.

Highschool Possession is another VN developed by A.J.Tilley (now known as Dharker Studios) about a guy romancing schoolmates, female if you were wondering. The story goes around a guy whose name I don't remember and his relationship with two of the most beautiful girls in his highschool. One would say that there's nothing weird with that, a typical VN, but this is not the case.

Warning! Some Spoilers Ahead
When I was expecting some kind of paranormal activity including ghosts and some other manifestations (the title misguided me), I was surprised with a different kind of possession and not a good one. You, as in the protagonist, are faced with the idea of been inside your female friends bodies and in total control of them, which means you have to make the appropriate decisions to, not only make everyone believe you are the girl but also to change their fates and lives and, if the time is right, make one of them fall in love with you.

Pros.
- Different endings
- Interesting not so interesting story
- CGs
- It has a R18 patch for those of you who likes them

Cons.
- The not so interesting story part
- Kind of short
- Almost predictable
- Music

Then, why am I recommending this? The same with Divine Slice of Life, no Meh button in Steam.

If you want it, wait for a sale.

reviewText:
Thank you KageSpartan for the game donation.

I was pleasantly surprised by Highschool Possession. I went in, expecting a cliched visual novel that should belong in the Steam trash bag but I found myself surprisingly enjoying it.

I have a weird feeling this is gonna be a shorter review than what I usually write as there isn't as much to cover in a visual novel than in other games.

For those who are unfammilliar with a visual novel then I'll give you a quick introduction. Visual novels are quite self explanatory. It's a novel that you have visuals to accompany you. So for those that only care about the gameplay of a game, then you probbly won't like visual novels, but, if you're like me and enjoy the story of a game or if you're someone who likes to play/watch something  different in you life, then visual novels might be perfect for you. I'm not saying there isn't any gameplay in a visual novel, there is gameplay but it isn't the central focus. The gameplay of a visual novel is just you choosing wht you might say in a certain situation but that's just about the only gameplay there is in a visual novel.

With the introduction to a visual novel out of the way, I'll get onto the actual review now.

Highschool Possession doesn't have as much gameplay as othr visual novels do but that doesn't always mean that it's going to be bad but the gameplay sections of Highschool Possessions don't come up that often and it didn't feel like I was affecting much of what would happen in the story with these decisions. The game is about 2 hours long and you could maybe streatch it to 3 hours if you want to see all of the endings but there are only around 5 sections of the game where you can change the affects of the game and all of them feel like hey won't make much of a difference to the events that will unfold.

Now onto the main part a visual novel needs to get right, the story. Does it succeed? Yes. The story is really compelling and has a great message to get out to people and even though it's sort of a message to teen troubles, it was still fun going through the story and it included likeable characters, despite only having around 8 included. The story is that you're a boy named Hikaru and he has a crush on 2 female students. He doesn't know which one to ask out. However, one morning he wakes up to find that he keeps on switching between thse 2 girls' bodies, everytime he falls asleep. When he's in their bodies, he gets to experience what their life is like and starts to discover some dark secrets that they have never opened up about. I was really invested within this story and was really curious and wanted to find out what the hell was going on within their lives and wantedd to see how this would all end.

The visual art that goes along with this game is definately some of the best that's on Steam. The backgrounds looked beautiful to look at, the characters were well designed. The dialogue is for the most part good however, there was quite a few grammar mistakes that I noticed through the story but nothing seemed misspelle which was a good sign compared to a few other visual novels that I've played.

I think that if you're wanting to see what a really good visual novel is like, give this a try. It takes a message that we've all heard tons of times when we were teens and kids but actually wraps it up into a compelling narrative to make you pleased that you've heard it again.

Pros
+ Great story
+ Good way of displaying it's message
+ Great visual art
+ Good character designs

Cons
- Not many choices
- Frequent grammar mistakes

Final verdict: 8/10

My steam curator group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/MellowReviews

reviewText: A shory story, but enjoyable to breeze through. Actually does have a somewhat meaningful message about the struggles everyone goes through while presenting a completely different face to the rest of the world, although there isn't time to explore that to a huge degree. The different choices don't change very much about the story except for determining which of the four endings you end up with. The writing is of good quality though and the artwork has a more western style, but isn't bad. There are some scenes that are not adults only but gratiuitous just for fanservice purposes, but that's true of almost every VN.  If money is an issue, you might want to wait for a sale, as 6.99 for a 70 minute game might not be good for everyone's budget.

reviewText: For as happy as this game seems to be advertised, it's surprisely dark. After you disappear" you take on the body of one of the girls you idolize and you keep flip flopping between them. One of which is being horrifically bullied while the other is in an abusive relationship. You help them while in their bodies without them realizing it. It sounds like a wonky Freaky Friday piece of crap but I actually enjoyed it. I felt like I was actually making a difference. I was filled with determination! I felt empowered and good about myself that I was able to help them realize the power in themselves.\n\nIt's a short game so it won't eat up too much of your time and since it IS a dating sim of sorts you can end up with the one of the girls you possess at the end. But the real take away here is it's not quite a fluffy
date: highly eroticized sort've game. It's got some depth to it that other VN's lack and I can honestly say I appreciated that a lot.\n\n10/10"

reviewText:
In this VN u will be playing as Hikaru. During this VN u will switch with the bodies of two girls and try to help them with their lives with desisions and such.

The characters were alright and the character art was nice too. The BG was alright and the music was amazing:) I really liked the music a lot.

The only con I found to this VN was that it was short. The bad ending's could of been fleshed more.  I don't think it's worth the full price. I recommened to get on a sale or a bundle. I got this through a bundle.

So if u want to kill some time then get this VN to play. Achievements are very easy to get since there is a guide on here to help u:). Also there is an 18+ patch to get if u are interested to play the adult version of the game.
